module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters

-- | For a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application, provides
--   additional mapping information when the record format uses delimiters,
--   such as CSV. For example, the following sample records use CSV format,
--   where the records use the <i>'\n'</i> as the row delimiter and a comma
--   (",") as the column delimiter:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "name1", "address1"
--   </pre>
--   
--   <pre>
--   "name2", "address2"
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCSVMappingParameters</a> smart constructor.
data CSVMappingParameters
CSVMappingParameters' :: Text -> Text -> CSVMappingParameters

-- | The row delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, <i>'\n'</i> is the
--   typical row delimiter.
[$sel:recordRowDelimiter:CSVMappingParameters'] :: CSVMappingParameters -> Text

-- | The column delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (",") is
--   the typical column delimiter.
[$sel:recordColumnDelimiter:CSVMappingParameters'] :: CSVMappingParameters -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CSVMappingParameters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordRowDelimiter:CSVMappingParameters'</a>,
--   <a>cSVMappingParameters_recordRowDelimiter</a> - The row delimiter.
--   For example, in a CSV format, <i>'\n'</i> is the typical row
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordColumnDelimiter:CSVMappingParameters'</a>,
--   <a>cSVMappingParameters_recordColumnDelimiter</a> - The column
--   delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (",") is the typical
--   column delimiter.
newCSVMappingParameters :: Text -> Text -> CSVMappingParameters

-- | The row delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, <i>'\n'</i> is the
--   typical row delimiter.
cSVMappingParameters_recordRowDelimiter :: Lens' CSVMappingParameters Text

-- | The column delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (",") is
--   the typical column delimiter.
cSVMappingParameters_recordColumnDelimiter :: Lens' CSVMappingParameters Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CSVMappingParameters.CSVMappingParameters

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription

--

--   constructor.
data CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription

-- | The ID of the CloudWatch logging option description.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptionId:CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription'] :: CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM ARN of the role to use to send application messages.
--   
--   Provided for backward compatibility. Applications created with the
--   current API version have an application-level service execution role
--   rather than a resource-level role.
[$sel:roleARN:CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription'] :: CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch log to receive
--   application messages.
[$sel:logStreamARN:CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription'] :: CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription -> Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The ID of the CloudWatch logging option description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription_roleARN</a> - The IAM ARN of the
--   role to use to send application messages.
--   
--   Provided for backward compatibility. Applications created with the
--   current API version have an application-level service execution role
--   rather than a resource-level role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logStreamARN:CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription_logStreamARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch log to receive application
--   messages.
newCloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription :: Text -> CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription

-- | The ID of the CloudWatch logging option description.
cloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptionId :: Lens' CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM ARN of the role to use to send application messages.
--

--   current API version have an application-level service execution role
--   rather than a resource-level role.

--   application messages.
cloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription_logStreamARN :: Lens' CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescription Text

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate

-- | Describes updates to the checkpointing parameters for a Flink-based
--   Kinesis Data Analytics application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCheckpointConfigurationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
CheckpointConfigurationUpdate' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ConfigurationType -> CheckpointConfigurationUpdate

-- | Describes updates to the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint
--   operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
[$sel:checkpointIntervalUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'] :: CheckpointConfigurationUpdate -> Maybe Natural

-- | Describes updates to whether checkpointing is enabled for an
--   application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
[$sel:checkpointingEnabledUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'] :: CheckpointConfigurationUpdate -> Maybe Bool

-- | Describes updates to the minimum time in milliseconds after a
--   checkpoint operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can
--   start.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
[$sel:minPauseBetweenCheckpointsUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'] :: CheckpointConfigurationUpdate -> Maybe Natural

-- | Describes updates to whether the application uses the default
--   checkpointing behavior of Kinesis Data Analytics. You must set this
--   property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in order to set the
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt>, <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, or
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> parameters.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:configurationTypeUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'] :: CheckpointConfigurationUpdate -> Maybe ConfigurationType

-- | Create a value of <a>CheckpointConfigurationUpdate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkpointIntervalUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationUpdate_checkpointIntervalUpdate</a> -
--   Describes updates to the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint
--   operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkpointingEnabledUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationUpdate_checkpointingEnabledUpdate</a> -
--   Describes updates to whether checkpointing is enabled for an
--   application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:minPauseBetweenCheckpointsUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationUpdate_minPauseBetweenCheckpointsUpdate</a>
--   - Describes updates to the minimum time in milliseconds after a
--   checkpoint operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can
--   start.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationTypeUpdate:CheckpointConfigurationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationUpdate_configurationTypeUpdate</a> -
--   Describes updates to whether the application uses the default
--   checkpointing behavior of Kinesis Data Analytics. You must set this
--   property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in order to set the
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt>, <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, or
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> parameters.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
newCheckpointConfigurationUpdate :: CheckpointConfigurationUpdate

-- | Describes updates to the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint
--   operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfigurationUpdate_checkpointIntervalUpdate :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationUpdate (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes updates to whether checkpointing is enabled for an
--   application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfigurationUpdate_checkpointingEnabledUpdate :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationUpdate (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes updates to the minimum time in milliseconds after a
--   checkpoint operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can
--   start.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfigurationUpdate_minPauseBetweenCheckpointsUpdate :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationUpdate (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes updates to whether the application uses the default
--   checkpointing behavior of Kinesis Data Analytics. You must set this
--   property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in order to set the
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt>, <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, or
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> parameters.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
checkpointConfigurationUpdate_configurationTypeUpdate :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationUpdate (Maybe ConfigurationType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate.CheckpointConfigurationUpdate


module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription

-- | Describes checkpointing parameters for a Flink-based Kinesis Data
--   Analytics application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCheckpointConfigurationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CheckpointConfigurationDescription
CheckpointConfigurationDescription' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe ConfigurationType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> CheckpointConfigurationDescription

-- | Describes whether checkpointing is enabled for a Flink-based Kinesis
--   Data Analytics application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
[$sel:checkpointingEnabled:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'] :: CheckpointConfigurationDescription -> Maybe Bool

-- | Describes whether the application uses the default checkpointing
--   behavior in Kinesis Data Analytics.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:configurationType:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'] :: CheckpointConfigurationDescription -> Maybe ConfigurationType

-- | Describes the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint
--   operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
[$sel:minPauseBetweenCheckpoints:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'] :: CheckpointConfigurationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Describes the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
[$sel:checkpointInterval:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'] :: CheckpointConfigurationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CheckpointConfigurationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkpointingEnabled:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationDescription_checkpointingEnabled</a> -
--   Describes whether checkpointing is enabled for a Flink-based Kinesis
--   Data Analytics application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationType:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationDescription_configurationType</a> -
--   Describes whether the application uses the default checkpointing
--   behavior in Kinesis Data Analytics.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:minPauseBetweenCheckpoints:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationDescription_minPauseBetweenCheckpoints</a> -
--   Describes the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint
--   operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkpointInterval:CheckpointConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfigurationDescription_checkpointInterval</a> -
--   Describes the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
newCheckpointConfigurationDescription :: CheckpointConfigurationDescription

-- | Describes whether checkpointing is enabled for a Flink-based Kinesis
--   Data Analytics application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfigurationDescription_checkpointingEnabled :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes whether the application uses the default checkpointing
--   behavior in Kinesis Data Analytics.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
checkpointConfigurationDescription_configurationType :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationDescription (Maybe ConfigurationType)

-- | Describes the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint
--   operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfigurationDescription_minPauseBetweenCheckpoints :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfigurationDescription_checkpointInterval :: Lens' CheckpointConfigurationDescription (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription.CheckpointConfigurationDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription.CheckpointConfigurationDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription.CheckpointConfigurationDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription.CheckpointConfigurationDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription.CheckpointConfigurationDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription.CheckpointConfigurationDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfigurationDescription.CheckpointConfigurationDescription


module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfiguration

-- | Describes an application's checkpointing configuration. Checkpointing
--   is the process of persisting application state for fault tolerance.
--   For more information, see <a>Checkpoints for Fault Tolerance</a> in
--   the <a>Apache Flink Documentation</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCheckpointConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data CheckpointConfiguration
CheckpointConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> ConfigurationType -> CheckpointConfiguration

-- | Describes whether checkpointing is enabled for a Flink-based Kinesis
--   Data Analytics application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
[$sel:checkpointingEnabled:CheckpointConfiguration'] :: CheckpointConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Describes the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint
--   operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start. If a
--   checkpoint operation takes longer than the
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, the application otherwise performs
--   continual checkpoint operations. For more information, see <a>Tuning
--   Checkpointing</a> in the <a>Apache Flink Documentation</a>.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
[$sel:minPauseBetweenCheckpoints:CheckpointConfiguration'] :: CheckpointConfiguration -> Maybe Natural

-- | Describes the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
[$sel:checkpointInterval:CheckpointConfiguration'] :: CheckpointConfiguration -> Maybe Natural

-- | Describes whether the application uses Kinesis Data Analytics' default
--   checkpointing behavior. You must set this property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt>
--   in order to set the <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt>,
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, or <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt>
--   parameters.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:configurationType:CheckpointConfiguration'] :: CheckpointConfiguration -> ConfigurationType

-- | Create a value of <a>CheckpointConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkpointingEnabled:CheckpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfiguration_checkpointingEnabled</a> - Describes
--   whether checkpointing is enabled for a Flink-based Kinesis Data
--   Analytics application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minPauseBetweenCheckpoints:CheckpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfiguration_minPauseBetweenCheckpoints</a> - Describes
--   the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint operation
--   completes that a new checkpoint operation can start. If a checkpoint
--   operation takes longer than the <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, the
--   application otherwise performs continual checkpoint operations. For
--   more information, see <a>Tuning Checkpointing</a> in the <a>Apache
--   Flink Documentation</a>.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkpointInterval:CheckpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfiguration_checkpointInterval</a> - Describes the
--   interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationType:CheckpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>checkpointConfiguration_configurationType</a> - Describes whether
--   the application uses Kinesis Data Analytics' default checkpointing
--   behavior. You must set this property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in order to
--   set the <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt>, <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, or
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> parameters.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
newCheckpointConfiguration :: ConfigurationType -> CheckpointConfiguration

-- | Describes whether checkpointing is enabled for a Flink-based Kinesis
--   Data Analytics application.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt> value of <tt>true</tt>, even if this
--   value is set to another value using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfiguration_checkpointingEnabled :: Lens' CheckpointConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint
--   operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start. If a
--   checkpoint operation takes longer than the
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, the application otherwise performs
--   continual checkpoint operations. For more information, see <a>Tuning
--   Checkpointing</a> in the <a>Apache Flink Documentation</a>.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt> value of 5000, even if this value
--   is set using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfiguration_minPauseBetweenCheckpoints :: Lens' CheckpointConfiguration (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.
--   
--   If <tt>CheckpointConfiguration.ConfigurationType</tt> is
--   <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use a
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt> value of 60000, even if this value is set
--   to another value using this API or in application code.
checkpointConfiguration_checkpointInterval :: Lens' CheckpointConfiguration (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes whether the application uses Kinesis Data Analytics' default
--   checkpointing behavior. You must set this property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt>
--   in order to set the <tt>CheckpointingEnabled</tt>,
--   <tt>CheckpointInterval</tt>, or <tt>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints</tt>
--   parameters.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>DEFAULT</tt>, the application will use the
--   following values, even if they are set to other values using APIs or
--   application code:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>CheckpointingEnabled:</b> true</li>
--   <li><b>CheckpointInterval:</b> 60000</li>
--   <li><b>MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints:</b> 5000</li>
--   </ul>
checkpointConfiguration_configurationType :: Lens' CheckpointConfiguration ConfigurationType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfiguration.CheckpointConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfiguration.CheckpointConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfiguration.CheckpointConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfiguration.CheckpointConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfiguration.CheckpointConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.CheckpointConfiguration.CheckpointConfiguration

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.FlinkRunConfiguration

-- | Describes the starting parameters for a Flink-based Kinesis Data
--   Analytics application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFlinkRunConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data FlinkRunConfiguration
FlinkRunConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> FlinkRunConfiguration

-- | When restoring from a snapshot, specifies whether the runtime is
--   allowed to skip a state that cannot be mapped to the new program. This
--   will happen if the program is updated between snapshots to remove
--   stateful parameters, and state data in the snapshot no longer
--   corresponds to valid application data. For more information, see
--   <a>Allowing Non-Restored State</a> in the <a>Apache Flink
--   documentation</a>.
--   
--   This value defaults to <tt>false</tt>. If you update your application
--   without specifying this parameter, <tt>AllowNonRestoredState</tt> will
--   be set to <tt>false</tt>, even if it was previously set to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:allowNonRestoredState:FlinkRunConfiguration'] :: FlinkRunConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>FlinkRunConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowNonRestoredState:FlinkRunConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>flinkRunConfiguration_allowNonRestoredState</a> - When restoring
--   from a snapshot, specifies whether the runtime is allowed to skip a
--   state that cannot be mapped to the new program. This will happen if
--   the program is updated between snapshots to remove stateful
--   parameters, and state data in the snapshot no longer corresponds to
--   valid application data. For more information, see <a>Allowing
--   Non-Restored State</a> in the <a>Apache Flink documentation</a>.
--   
--   This value defaults to <tt>false</tt>. If you update your application
--   without specifying this parameter, <tt>AllowNonRestoredState</tt> will
--   be set to <tt>false</tt>, even if it was previously set to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
newFlinkRunConfiguration :: FlinkRunConfiguration

-- | When restoring from a snapshot, specifies whether the runtime is
--   allowed to skip a state that cannot be mapped to the new program. This
--   will happen if the program is updated between snapshots to remove
--   stateful parameters, and state data in the snapshot no longer
--   corresponds to valid application data. For more information, see
--   <a>Allowing Non-Restored State</a> in the <a>Apache Flink
--   documentation</a>.
--   
--   This value defaults to <tt>false</tt>. If you update your application
--   without specifying this parameter, <tt>AllowNonRestoredState</tt> will
--   be set to <tt>false</tt>, even if it was previously set to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
flinkRunConfiguration_allowNonRestoredState :: Lens' FlinkRunConfiguration (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.FlinkRunConfiguration.FlinkRunConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.FlinkRunConfiguration.FlinkRunConfiguration

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.GlueDataCatalogConfigurationUpdate

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGlueDataCatalogConfigurationUpdate</a> smart

-- | Create a value of <a>GlueDataCatalogConfigurationUpdate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.InputLambdaProcessor

-- | An object that contains the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon
--   Lambda function that is used to preprocess records in the stream in a
--   SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLambdaProcessor</a> smart constructor.
data InputLambdaProcessor
InputLambdaProcessor' :: Text -> InputLambdaProcessor

-- | The ARN of the Amazon Lambda function that operates on records in the
--   stream.
--   
--   To specify an earlier version of the Lambda function than the latest,
--   include the Lambda function version in the Lambda function ARN. For
--   more information about Lambda ARNs, see <a>Example ARNs: Amazon
--   Lambda</a>
[$sel:resourceARN:InputLambdaProcessor'] :: InputLambdaProcessor -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputLambdaProcessor</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceARN:InputLambdaProcessor'</a>,
--   <a>inputLambdaProcessor_resourceARN</a> - The ARN of the Amazon Lambda
--   function that operates on records in the stream.
--   
--   To specify an earlier version of the Lambda function than the latest,
--   include the Lambda function version in the Lambda function ARN. For
--   more information about Lambda ARNs, see <a>Example ARNs: Amazon
--   Lambda</a>
newInputLambdaProcessor :: Text -> InputLambdaProcessor

-- | The ARN of the Amazon Lambda function that operates on records in the
--   stream.
--   
--   To specify an earlier version of the Lambda function than the latest,
--   include the Lambda function version in the Lambda function ARN. For
--   more information about Lambda ARNs, see <a>Example ARNs: Amazon
--   Lambda</a>
inputLambdaProcessor_resourceARN :: Lens' InputLambdaProcessor Text

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.InputLambdaProcessorDescription

-- | For a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application, an object that
--   contains the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Lambda function
--   that is used to preprocess records in the stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputLambdaProcessorDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.

InputLambdaProcessorDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> InputLambdaProcessorDescription

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that is used to access the Amazon Lambda
--   function.
--   
--   Provided for backward compatibility. Applications that are created
--   with the current API version have an application-level service
--   execution role rather than a resource-level role.

--   records in the stream.

--

--   include the Lambda function version in the Lambda function ARN. For

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.InputStartingPositionConfiguration

-- | Describes the point at which the application reads from the streaming
--   source.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputStartingPositionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InputStartingPositionConfiguration
InputStartingPositionConfiguration' :: Maybe InputStartingPosition -> InputStartingPositionConfiguration

-- | The starting position on the stream.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NOW</tt> - Start reading just after the most recent record in
--   the stream, and start at the request timestamp that the customer
--   issued.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRIM_HORIZON</tt> - Start reading at the last untrimmed record
--   in the stream, which is the oldest record available in the stream.
--   This option is not available for an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivery stream.</li>
--   <li><tt>LAST_STOPPED_POINT</tt> - Resume reading from where the
--   application last stopped reading.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:inputStartingPosition:InputStartingPositionConfiguration'] :: InputStartingPositionConfiguration -> Maybe InputStartingPosition

-- | Create a value of <a>InputStartingPositionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputStartingPosition:InputStartingPositionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inputStartingPositionConfiguration_inputStartingPosition</a> - The
--   starting position on the stream.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NOW</tt> - Start reading just after the most recent record in
--   the stream, and start at the request timestamp that the customer
--   issued.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRIM_HORIZON</tt> - Start reading at the last untrimmed record
--   in the stream, which is the oldest record available in the stream.
--   This option is not available for an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivery stream.</li>
--   <li><tt>LAST_STOPPED_POINT</tt> - Resume reading from where the
--   application last stopped reading.</li>
--   </ul>
newInputStartingPositionConfiguration :: InputStartingPositionConfiguration

-- | The starting position on the stream.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NOW</tt> - Start reading just after the most recent record in
--   the stream, and start at the request timestamp that the customer
--   issued.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRIM_HORIZON</tt> - Start reading at the last untrimmed record
--   in the stream, which is the oldest record available in the stream.
--   This option is not available for an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivery stream.</li>
--   <li><tt>LAST_STOPPED_POINT</tt> - Resume reading from where the
--   application last stopped reading.</li>
--   </ul>
inputStartingPositionConfiguration_inputStartingPosition :: Lens' InputStartingPositionConfiguration (Maybe InputStartingPosition)

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.KinesisStreamsInputUpdate

--

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.LambdaOutput

--   output, identifies an Amazon Lambda function as the destination. You

--   function.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaOutput</a> smart constructor.
data LambdaOutput
LambdaOutput' :: Text -> LambdaOutput

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination Lambda function to
--   write to.
--   
--   To specify an earlier version of the Lambda function than the latest,
--   include the Lambda function version in the Lambda function ARN. For
--   more information about Lambda ARNs, see <a>Example ARNs: Amazon
--   Lambda</a>
[$sel:resourceARN:LambdaOutput'] :: LambdaOutput -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaOutput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination Lambda function to
--   write to.
--   
--   To specify an earlier version of the Lambda function than the latest,
--   include the Lambda function version in the Lambda function ARN. For
--   more information about Lambda ARNs, see <a>Example ARNs: Amazon
--   Lambda</a>
newLambdaOutput :: Text -> LambdaOutput

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination Lambda function to
--   write to.
--   
--   To specify an earlier version of the Lambda function than the latest,
--   include the Lambda function version in the Lambda function ARN. For
--   more information about Lambda ARNs, see <a>Example ARNs: Amazon
--   Lambda</a>

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters

-- | When you configure a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application's
--   input at the time of creating or updating an application, provides
--   additional mapping information specific to the record format (such as
--   JSON, CSV, or record fields delimited by some delimiter) on the
--   streaming source.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMappingParameters</a> smart constructor.
data MappingParameters
MappingParameters' :: Maybe CSVMappingParameters -> Maybe JSONMappingParameters -> MappingParameters

-- | Provides additional mapping information when the record format uses
--   delimiters (for example, CSV).
[$sel:cSVMappingParameters:MappingParameters'] :: MappingParameters -> Maybe CSVMappingParameters

-- | Provides additional mapping information when JSON is the record format
--   on the streaming source.
[$sel:jSONMappingParameters:MappingParameters'] :: MappingParameters -> Maybe JSONMappingParameters

-- | Create a value of <a>MappingParameters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cSVMappingParameters:MappingParameters'</a>,
--   <a>mappingParameters_cSVMappingParameters</a> - Provides additional
--   mapping information when the record format uses delimiters (for
--   example, CSV).
--   
--   <a>$sel:jSONMappingParameters:MappingParameters'</a>,
--   <a>mappingParameters_jSONMappingParameters</a> - Provides additional
--   mapping information when JSON is the record format on the streaming
--   source.
newMappingParameters :: MappingParameters

-- | Provides additional mapping information when the record format uses
--   delimiters (for example, CSV).
mappingParameters_cSVMappingParameters :: Lens' MappingParameters (Maybe CSVMappingParameters)

-- | Provides additional mapping information when JSON is the record format
--   on the streaming source.
mappingParameters_jSONMappingParameters :: Lens' MappingParameters (Maybe JSONMappingParameters)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MappingParameters.MappingParameters


module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference

-- | The information required to specify a Maven reference. You can use
--   Maven references to specify dependency JAR files.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMavenReference</a> smart constructor.
data MavenReference
MavenReference' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> MavenReference

-- | The group ID of the Maven reference.
[$sel:groupId:MavenReference'] :: MavenReference -> Text

-- | The artifact ID of the Maven reference.
[$sel:artifactId:MavenReference'] :: MavenReference -> Text

-- | The version of the Maven reference.
[$sel:version:MavenReference'] :: MavenReference -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MavenReference</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:MavenReference'</a>, <a>mavenReference_groupId</a> -
--   The group ID of the Maven reference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:artifactId:MavenReference'</a>,
--   <a>mavenReference_artifactId</a> - The artifact ID of the Maven
--   reference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:MavenReference'</a>, <a>mavenReference_version</a> -
--   The version of the Maven reference.
newMavenReference :: Text -> Text -> Text -> MavenReference

-- | The group ID of the Maven reference.
mavenReference_groupId :: Lens' MavenReference Text

-- | The artifact ID of the Maven reference.
mavenReference_artifactId :: Lens' MavenReference Text

-- | The version of the Maven reference.
mavenReference_version :: Lens' MavenReference Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MavenReference.MavenReference

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MetricsLevel.MetricsLevel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MetricsLevel.MetricsLevel
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MetricsLevel.MetricsLevel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MetricsLevel.MetricsLevel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MetricsLevel.MetricsLevel

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration

-- | Describes configuration parameters for Amazon CloudWatch logging for
--   an application. For more information about CloudWatch logging, see
--   <a>Monitoring</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonitoringConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data MonitoringConfiguration
MonitoringConfiguration' :: Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe MetricsLevel -> ConfigurationType -> MonitoringConfiguration

-- | Describes the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.
[$sel:logLevel:MonitoringConfiguration'] :: MonitoringConfiguration -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | Describes the granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.
--   The <tt>Parallelism</tt> level is not recommended for applications
--   with a Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs.
[$sel:metricsLevel:MonitoringConfiguration'] :: MonitoringConfiguration -> Maybe MetricsLevel

-- | Describes whether to use the default CloudWatch logging configuration
--   for an application. You must set this property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in
--   order to set the <tt>LogLevel</tt> or <tt>MetricsLevel</tt>
--   parameters.
[$sel:configurationType:MonitoringConfiguration'] :: MonitoringConfiguration -> ConfigurationType

-- | Create a value of <a>MonitoringConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logLevel:MonitoringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>monitoringConfiguration_logLevel</a> - Describes the verbosity of
--   the CloudWatch Logs for an application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricsLevel:MonitoringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>monitoringConfiguration_metricsLevel</a> - Describes the
--   granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application. The
--   <tt>Parallelism</tt> level is not recommended for applications with a
--   Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationType:MonitoringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>monitoringConfiguration_configurationType</a> - Describes whether
--   to use the default CloudWatch logging configuration for an
--   application. You must set this property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in order to
--   set the <tt>LogLevel</tt> or <tt>MetricsLevel</tt> parameters.
newMonitoringConfiguration :: ConfigurationType -> MonitoringConfiguration

-- | Describes the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.
monitoringConfiguration_logLevel :: Lens' MonitoringConfiguration (Maybe LogLevel)

-- | Describes the granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.
--   The <tt>Parallelism</tt> level is not recommended for applications
--   with a Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs.
monitoringConfiguration_metricsLevel :: Lens' MonitoringConfiguration (Maybe MetricsLevel)

-- | Describes whether to use the default CloudWatch logging configuration
--   for an application. You must set this property to <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in
--   order to set the <tt>LogLevel</tt> or <tt>MetricsLevel</tt>
--   parameters.
monitoringConfiguration_configurationType :: Lens' MonitoringConfiguration ConfigurationType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration.MonitoringConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration.MonitoringConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration.MonitoringConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration.MonitoringConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration.MonitoringConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration.MonitoringConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfiguration.MonitoringConfiguration


module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfigurationDescription

-- | Describes configuration parameters for CloudWatch logging for an
--   application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonitoringConfigurationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data MonitoringConfigurationDescription
MonitoringConfigurationDescription' :: Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe ConfigurationType -> Maybe MetricsLevel -> MonitoringConfigurationDescription

-- | Describes the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.
[$sel:logLevel:MonitoringConfigurationDescription'] :: MonitoringConfigurationDescription -> Maybe LogLevel

-- | Describes whether to use the default CloudWatch logging configuration
--   for an application.

module Network.AWS.KinesisAnalyticsV2.Types.MonitoringConfigurationUpdate

-- | Describes updates to configuration parameters for Amazon CloudWatch
--   logging for an application.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonitoringConfigurationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data MonitoringConfigurationUpdate
MonitoringConfigurationUpdate' :: Maybe MetricsLevel -> Maybe LogLevel -> Maybe ConfigurationType -> MonitoringConfigurationUpdate

-- | Describes updates to the granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an
--   application. The <tt>Parallelism</tt> level is not recommended for
--   applications with a Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs.
[$sel:metricsLevelUpdate:MonitoringConfigurationUpdate'] :: MonitoringConfigurationUpdate -> Maybe MetricsLevel

-- | Describes updates to the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an
--   application.
[$sel:logLevelUpdate:MonitoringConfigurationUpdate'] :: MonitoringConfigurationUpdate -> Maybe LogLevel

--   configuration for an application. You must set this property to
--   <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in order to set the <tt>LogLevel</tt> or
--   <tt>MetricsLevel</tt> parameters.
[$sel:configurationTypeUpdate:MonitoringConfigurationUpdate'] :: MonitoringConfigurationUpdate -> Maybe ConfigurationType

--   with a Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logLevelUpdate:MonitoringConfigurationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>monitoringConfigurationUpdate_logLevelUpdate</a> - Describes
--   updates to the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationTypeUpdate:MonitoringConfigurationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>monitoringConfigurationUpdate_configurationTypeUpdate</a> -
--   Describes updates to whether to use the default CloudWatch logging
--   configuration for an application. You must set this property to
--   <tt>CUSTOM</tt> in order to set the <tt>LogLevel</tt> or
--   <tt>MetricsLevel</tt> parameters.
newMonitoringConfigurationUpdate :: MonitoringConfigurationUpdate

-- | Describes updates to the granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an
--   application. The <tt>Parallelism</tt> level is not recommended for
--   applications with a Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs.

--   application.
